str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A Nazarene, an inhabitant of Nazareth. From Nazareth; a Nazoraean, i.e. Inhabitant of Nazareth; by extension, a Christian.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and luo; to loosen down, i.e. to demolish; specially to halt for the night.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To change, alter, exchange, transform. From allos; to make different.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A custom, habit; an institute, rite. From etho; a usage.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural

str2: Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
